document_data.name: Bug
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|18-19}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Bug''''' was a personal [[cantrip]] that beginning [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It summoned an angry crawling insect to a spot chosen by the caster.
document_data.Effects: Similar to ''[[bee (cantrip)|bee]]'', this cantrip conjured a single, normal-sized, crawling insect named by the caster. It appeared at a spot within {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}}The original description of this spell in [[Dragon magazine 60|''Dragon'' #60]] used the 1{{st}}-edition nomenclature 1", meaning {{SI|10|ft}} indoors and {{SI|10|yd}} outdoors. This was simplified to the shorter range in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. and visible to the caster (that is, it could not be inside a pouch or beneath clothing, for example). The insect was annoyed by the summoning and immediately attacked if it appeared on a living creature.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster focused their vision on the spot where the bug was to appear, spoke the type of the insect desired, and made a sliding motion with a forefinger that ended with pointing at the target.
